text: basically what we're doing I can show you this week here because it'll be easy to see easier to see than a small week usually you don't claim me to weed that is this big we're trying to get them when they just emerge but if you look at this thing we passed the flame over pretty quickly and you can see it's already starting to wilt down it's not like charred to charcoal or burn or anything but when I pinch one of the leaves I can see it leaves a really dark spot where I can tell that the cells the plant cells have ruptured because what has happened is the flame has heated up the water in the plant cells enough so that the cell wall expands and bursts and so this weed will wilt and die you know if we come back in a couple hours and look at it what you're trying to do you can either use flame eating for a stale bedding technique meaning that you know letting the weeds in the top one or two inches of the soil sort of express themselves over the period of one or two weeks and you can come through the flame leader and sort of boiled them off the bed top so that's creating a stale seed bed and after a couple of passes like that a lot of the weeds that are on the top layer of the soil have already germinated so you have it's stale the main application that we would use it for is will seed a crop into a bed and before the crop emerges we'll pass the flame leader leader over the surface of the soil crop is under the soil so it stays protected but the weeds that are on the top of the bed are plain weeded and then the crop emerges up into a clean seed bed
